problem_text:
17.85. Let V be a variety of groups such that any free group in V has torsion-free integral homology groups in all dimensions. Is it true that V is abelian?
It is known that free metabelian groups may have 2-torsion in the second homology groups, and free nilpotent groups of class 2 may have 3-torsion in the fourth homology groups.
R. Mikhailov
